name: Swiss Connection
overview: Swiss Connection is a 1-2 player co-operative skiing themed shooter for the Commodore 64. It was developed by Alf Yngve using SEUCK and published by Binary Zone PD in 1991. In the game, you play an Interpol agent following a trace to the Swiss Apls, where the person suspected to be "Mr. Big" in the biggest drug cartel in Europe is located. You find proof in his house, but his bodyguards discover you! You dash down the mountainside to reach the police station before his thugs can get you. Then you must return with the local police to arrest "Mr. Big" before he leaves the country. Good luck!
